result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Darius L Dolley not in court.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
State would like bond forfeited.
Surety is in court and does not agree, would like bond returned to him. 
BTC:   Bond forfeiture hearing held. Bond forfeiture w/be addressed at time of arrest. Bonds to continue.

Bond forfeiture notice -
     Order forfeiting bail and notice of application for judgment. $200 cash bond; missed hrg 7-14-15

Attorney Mindy M. Nolan in court.  Thomas Jerome Coaty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
BTC: BW to remain outstanding, bond forfeited.

ADDRESS INFO for Darius L Dolley
Current: 3420 Lindermann Ave Upper, Racine, WI 53405 United States  (Effective: 07-10-2015)
Prior: 2202 Layard Ave, Racine, WI 53404 United States
From SPD to change address
Warrant/capias/commitment entered into all three systems and forwarded to RCSO.
Deft failed to post bond by 6/17/15.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: ***DEFT HAS 48 HOURS TO POST THE ADDITIONAL $100, FAILURE TO POST, DEFT MUST REPORT TO RCJ*** It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Darius L Dolley in court with attorney Mindy M. Nolan.  Christopher D. Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
Matter is scheduled on the Court's Motion to review bond.
Deft is non compliant with ZCI.
State is asking for an additional $100 cash for a total of $200 cash.
Def indicates the deft does not have anymore money to post.
Def requests bond not be modified at this time.
Def indicates that the deft states he thinks if the gets tested today it would come back clean.
BTC: Modify bond to $200 cash, deft will have 48 hrs to post the additional $100.00, failure to post, deft must report to RCJ.

Notice of Hearing for 06-15-2015
RTS, Attempted Not Known, UTF
